speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: Vodka on the rocks.

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: Hi. How are ya?

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: Thirsty.

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: Um, straight up. And no ice this time.

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: I tell this guy about the ice and then he pours me a scotch rocks.

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: What's wrong with the ice?

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: It's the water, actually, in the ice. I'm kind of an expert on it.

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: Well, what's wrong with it?

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: No big secret. It's been in the news. Government additive. Something they call chloramine.

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: Yeah, they say that's good for us, it's like fluoride or something.

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: Well, that's what they say. Look, um, I didn't sit down here to scare you. On the contrary.

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: Would you like to get some air?

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: Long way to go for a drink, huh?

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: Do you like living out here?

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: How much farther?

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: Just over the bridge.

speaker: (CUT OVER TO
line: A bridge over the river. It is a drawbridge over the Potomac River and now it is in the process of rising up. The barricade is being closed and we see the lights of the CARL WORMUS's car approaching at speed.)

speaker: (CUT BACK
line: In the car. CARL WORMUS is slowing the car down because of the rising bridge. SHANNON MCMAHON slowly puts her left hand down on the CARL WORMUS's right leg. He smiles, as she does it. All of a sudden, she presses her hand down firmly on his leg pressing his foot down on the accelerator. The car begins speeding up.)

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: What the hell you doing?

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: Let go!

speaker: CARL WORMUS
line: You'll gonna kill us!

speaker: CHRIS CARTER
line: Last season on The X-Files...

speaker: KNOWLE ROHRER
line: There was a rumoured program out of the cold war. A plan to create a super-soldier.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I didn't want to believe it. He said Agent Scully's a part of that program too.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Your baby was a miracle.

speaker: SCULLY
line: My baby is normal.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: She may never even make it out of this building.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get him off!

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is my baby! Please don't let them take it!

speaker: REYES
line: Push, Dana!

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This office is under investigation. For the late-night meeting between you and an intelligence operative named Knowle Rohrer.

speaker: KERSH
line: You investigate what I tell you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You put me on the X-Files.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think what we feared were the possibilities. The truth we both know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's going to be okay... She pats him on his back and walks with him into the living room, gently holding him in her arms. On the living room floor we see several packed suitcases.)

speaker: REYES
line: Hello?

speaker: MAN ON PHONE
line: Monica, it's me. Did I wake you?

speaker: REYES
line: Brad. Um-hmm, no, I'm awake.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: You're in town?

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah, I, I came in on short notice.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Listen, if you're coming into the Hoover Building can you stop by my office on your way in?

speaker: (CUT BACK
line: to REYES. Camera pans around her face.)

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah. Sure. I can do that.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Good. Looking forward to it.

speaker: (CUT BACK
line: to DOGGETT's house. The kettle on the stove whistles. He pours some boiling water into a cup. As he's making his breakfast, he listens to a news report on TV.)

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: ... last night. The 38 year old body of Carl Wormus, a deputy administrator for the Environmental Protection Agency was pulled from the Potomac by divers this morning...

speaker: TV ANNOUNCER
line: ... it appears Wormus drove his car through a barricade on the drawbridge into the river. A police spokesperson said it appears he was alone in the car...

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Monica?

speaker: REYES
line: Hi.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: What you doing?

speaker: REYES
line: I was leaving you a note. Your assistant was out and... I didn't want to knock. I was gonna call you, uh. Um, hi, Brad.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Come on in.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: What?

speaker: REYES
line: We're at work.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: You used to ask me to close the door at work back in New York.

speaker: REYES
line: Is that all you called me here for, Assistant Director?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I probably shouldn't tell you how hot you look either, because you do. How long's it been? Two years?

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah. We should catch up, Brad. Really. I've got to get downstairs.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I've got something for you.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Forgive me, but... uh... it didn't take a whole lot of digging to figure out why you're here in D.C., Monica.

speaker: REYES
line: What are those?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Something you're gonna see... but I wanted to show you first. They were taken from security cameras in the FBI parking garage. One of them... shows you arriving in a cab meeting with John Doggett.

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah, I'm working with him. He called me up here on a case.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I heard. Believe me, this whole thing about a chase and a crash and a fire. And now Doggett's internal investigation of Deputy Director Kersh... it's... big news.

speaker: REYES
line: What's so important to show me?

speaker: REYES
line: What's on the other tape?

speaker: KERSH
line: How's your investigation going, John? Have you turned up any incriminating evidence on me yet?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It's only Monday morning, sir. It's nothing personal, Deputy Director. I hope you know that.

speaker: KERSH
line: I know, John. I think we've pretty much always seen eye to eye. I'm sure if you can't find anything on me, John, nobody can.

speaker: REYES
line: Hi. How you doing?

speaker: REYES
line: That good?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I didn't ask to be put down on the X- Files. Deputy Director Kersh put me down here. I'm just doing my job. What did they think? That I'd be thankful? That I'd do anything less?

speaker: REYES
line: It's not gonna be easy, John.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Hell no it isn't. I'm going after the Deputy Director, the one man removed from the head of the FBI.

speaker: REYES
line: No, I mean it may be impossible.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's this?

speaker: REYES
line: A security tape two nights ago from the FBI garage. You're not on it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No. This is the wrong damn tape.

speaker: REYES
line: I've been backwards and forwards on it. There's nothing there.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We were chased. AD Skinner and I were attacked and chased. This man Knowle Rohrer drove his car into the garage wall and it blew up in a ball of flames.

speaker: REYES
line: Not on this tape.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where'd you get this?

speaker: REYES
line: From someone who wanted to give me a heads-up.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: They can't just make this all go away. There's evidence down in that parking garage, there were victims.

speaker: REYES
line: I went down to that garage, John. Whatever happened, they've had 48 hours now to clean it up.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: There were witnesses.

speaker: REYES
line: Witnesses who are gonna stand up to this tape?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Mulder, you here?

speaker: OPERATOR'S VOICE ON PHONE
line: Naval telecommunications command.

speaker: ROLAND MCFARLAND
line: Yeah, I need to make a shore to ship call, to the U.S. Valor Victor.

speaker: OPERATOR'S VOICE ON PHONE
line: Sir?...

speaker: OPERATOR'S VOICE ON PHONE
line: Sir?...

speaker: SCULLY
line: What? What's the matter?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's the matter? I've been trying to call you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, the phone's off the hook because of the baby.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I got panicked that you're not going to be here, that you left, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Come in.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I've been looking for Mulder. I went to his apartment.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Where'd he go?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dana... where'd he go?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's gone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's just... gone.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know where Mulder is. I don't know that I'd tell you if I did.

speaker: REYES
line: I checked with movers, airlines, car rental agencies... no Mulder.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Somebody get to him, that it? That doesn't seem possible, does it? Okay, so where does that leave us? Just me and you, our word against Kersh and the FBI.

speaker: REYES
line: You'd better sit down, John. It's more complicated than that.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's more complicated?

speaker: REYES
line: This investigation.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What about it?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I wanna ask you to drop it.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: No, not from you. Not from you. Not, not after what we've been through. I mean, we barely escaped with our lives.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's something worth thinking about.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm sorry, you're not that reasonable. What, did they get to you too?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No one got to me, John, they didn't have to, that's the point.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You're afraid of them.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not afraid of them.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, you're afraid of something. What? The real tape showing up, them calling you a killer for you having to shoot Alex Krycek?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, I'll stand by my actions, Agent Doggett, but I won't stand by yours if you're gonna continue to push and push until you get somebody killed. You wanna know what I fear? I fear for Mulder and Scully. I fear for the life of that child if you don't stop pushing it, John.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You don't think I fear for those things, same as you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: If you did, you'd let it go.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: So what I'm hearing is... if I don't drop it, I'm alone on this.

speaker: REYES
line: John.

speaker: REYES
line: You're not.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Hi. I hope it wasn't too presumptuous of me. I've ordered you a Martini.

speaker: REYES
line: No, the presumption's all mine. Anyway, I called and asked you out, didn't I?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: You, uh, actually a little confused me this morning in my office. I had this crazy notion that you're avoiding me.

speaker: REYES
line: Maybe I was trying to avoid myself.

speaker: REYES
line: And those tapes you pulled out of your desk drawer weren't exactly Pamela and Tommy Lee now, were they?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I'd heard that you and John Doggett are tight.

speaker: REYES
line: You make it sound like I go home from work with Post-Its on my ass. It's nothing like that.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Then I don't get it. Why risk your name and your career getting caught up in this... rabid investigation of his?

speaker: REYES
line: There isn't going to be an investigation. Not anymore.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I wouldn't have thought Agent Doggett would be thrown off so easy. Not what I've heard about him.

speaker: REYES
line: Whatever you may think about him, Brad, he's not a fool, you know.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Now you're pissed off at me.

speaker: REYES
line: No, I'm pissed off because this means I'll be shipping back to the New Orleans field office.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: What are you talking about? The way I heard it you're with the X-Files?

speaker: REYES
line: If this investigation drops, they're gonna drop the X-Files right along with it. You know me, where my interests lie, this was my dream assignment. Not to mention how excited I was to be appointed here in D.C.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: But you just got here.

speaker: REYES
line: Yeah, I know.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I'm really sorry. I... Dana, I need your help.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know how to find him.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: It just doesn't make any sense. Mulder leaving you here all alone, just walking out on you, not telling you where and why.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It makes sense in its own way. That's all I can tell you.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Then tell me why you can't trust me. Everything I did to try and protect you when you thought your baby was in danger. What changed? Why is it suddenly I'm now the enemy?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let it go, John. Drop it. Please.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: These people tried to kill me. They tried to kill AD Skinner. They wanted to kill Mulder, too. They're still out there, Dana.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Exactly right, and they are unstoppable, and they are inside the FBI.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: You know something you're not telling me. Mulder knows something. How long can you hide it from me? Knowle Rohrer, this old military buddy of mine. He told me your pregnancy was a result of a Government cloning experiment to try to create what he called a Super Soldier.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't want to hear this. Look, there is nothing to any of this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Knowle Rohrer, my buddy, was one of the men that tried to kill us in the FBI garage.

speaker: SCULLY
line: My baby... my son... is fine.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I hope to God that's true. I just don't want to pretend.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to ask you to leave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to ask you to leave and not come back here.

speaker: OPERATOR'S VOICE
line: Directory assistance, may I help you?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Let's try Maryland, Virginia.

speaker: OPERATOR'S VOICE
line: What district?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Number for a Ryan Bracker. B-R-A-C-K-E-R.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah hi, I was given this number for a Roger Erickson, formerly with the US Marine Corps.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Roger, hey, it's John Doggett, Bravo Company.

speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
line: How you doing?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Eh, I'm good. It's good to hear you. Listen, you remember Knowle Rohrer? What's the story with him? Didn't he get involved with something when he got back Stateside.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, let's get you a beer sometime.

speaker: VOICE OF SHANNON MCMAHON
line: This is Shannon. Leave a message and I'll return your call...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, hi, this is John Doggett. I'm trying to reach Shannon McMahon who was with Bravo Company U.S.M.C. If this is she can you please contact me to the FBI in Washington, D.C. as soon as possible?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sleepy time, sweet William. See you in a couple of hours.

speaker: REYES
line: Uh...

speaker: REYES
line: Hello?

speaker: REYES
line: Monica Reyes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's, er, Scully.

speaker: REYES
line: Dana, are you all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is Agent Doggett there?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Dana. Something wrong?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. Yeah, something. Um, I think I might have been wrong, telling you to drop your investigation.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Well, I didn't drop it. As a matter of fact, we found something that sure as hell fits with what we are working on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: A body.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thanks for coming.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: The deceased's name is Carl Wormus. Deputy Administrator for the Environmental Protection Agency.

speaker: REYES
line: Drove though a barricade and off a bridge two nights ago.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And somebody at the FBI thought it was important enough to stick his obituary right under our noses.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who?

speaker: REYES
line: We don't know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, his blood alcohol level was up 0.15. He was drunk, he crashed and drowned.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: There's got to be something more.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: John Doggett.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Excuse me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you know how many people are just waiting to see you screw up. To see you make a mistake like this.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I didn't know I made a mistake.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This EPA guy you checked out of the morgue in Maryland without any jurisdiction.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Oh, come on.

speaker: SKINNER
line: All your friends, John. All your former buddies at the FBI.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SKINNER
line: They're not your pals any more. Not since this investigation here, since you launched an attack on one of your own. Just watch your back, John.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Definitive answer how this guy died, what'll that take?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Careful autopsy.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: How fast can you do it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not what I'm saying.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I understand if you don't want to do this, Dana, but you're the only person we can trust.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Collecting for the needy and unemployed. Open the door.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Thanks for doing this, guys.

speaker: BYERS
line: Yeah, like we got anything better to be doing these days.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Just to let you know, we may need to get you up for some coin.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What happened to him, you guys?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Don't ask.

speaker: BYERS
line: We were able to hack into the Department of Interior's mainframe and get the EPA files you wanted. On this man Carl Wormus...

speaker: DOGGETT
line: And?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Hey, what are we mind readers? That's all that you asked us to do.

speaker: BYERS
line: What exactly was it you are looking for, if we may ask?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: I don't know. I was hoping you'd find something.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Well, if he had any secrets he took 'em to his grave. Nothing hinky in these files except for some rabid obsession with water.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: With water?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Water. Asphyxiation produced by the inhalation of water>. There are contusions on the forehead and on the chest but that isn't in fact hat killed him. This man drowned. You're looking at me like you hope that there's something more, but there isn't.

speaker: REYES
line: I'm sorry, that's not it. I'm just impressed that you can do this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is what I do, Agent Reyes.

speaker: REYES
line: But you're here doing it now. Something did happen, didn't it.

speaker: REYES
line: I know what you're afraid of. That there's something wrong with your baby.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We can let our fears get the better of us. We can, uh, imagine things, make connections with things that aren't there. Like with this man.

speaker: REYES
line: If you ever feel the need to talk to someone, Dana, I'm here. I'd never betray a confidence.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There is something.

speaker: REYES
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Right here on the ankle.

speaker: REYES
line: Are those... fingerprints?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, that's what they look like.

speaker: REYES
line: Was someone holding him down?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know how, or who.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I don't know if you're aware where Agent Scully is. She's at Quantico. Called in by John Doggett to autopsy a body he's got not authority to touch.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: If I may be blunt, Sir, Doggett's put his tit in the wringer.

speaker: KERSH
line: Maybe. So what?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: All of think he's lost all judgment. That not one man's actions should affect the entire FBI. We're feeling he should be called out for this.

speaker: KERSH
line: Punished?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Yes, Sir.

speaker: KERSH
line: Thank you, Assistant Director. It's a difficult situation to be in, I appreciate you doing this.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: It was a right thing to do.

speaker: KERSH
line: Let me know how it goes.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Me? No, no, I can't, Sir. There... there is a conflict. I, I can't do this myself.

speaker: KERSH
line: I can't very well do it. How would it look? I'm under investigation by Agent Doggett. You have no personal axe to grind.

speaker: MARGARET
line: Hello? Can I help you?

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: Hi, I'm looking for Dana Scully.

speaker: MARGARET
line: Uh, I'm sorry, she's not here right now. Can I tell her who's calling?

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: We work together. Do you know where I can find her?

speaker: MARGARET
line: No, um, would you like to leave a message?

speaker: SHANNON MCMAHON
line: I'll leave a note if you wouldn't mind opening the door.

speaker: MARGARET
line: Why don't you just leave your name and I'll have Dana call you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need to get this body into refrigeration if you want to preserve it as evidence. Whatever he's evidence of...

speaker: REYES
line: Whatever it is I can't reach John to even tell him about it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Monica, I don't know what to say, but good luck. I gotta go. I gotta get home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Third floor they have a cooler for the teaching cadavers. We could temporarily put him up there.

speaker: REYES
line: Behind us. Just keep walking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who is she?

speaker: REYES
line: I've never seen her before this morning. Now I've seen her twice.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Where's Agent Doggett?

speaker: REYES
line: What are you doing, Brad?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: What am I doing? I'm doing my best to cover your ass.

speaker: REYES
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: This... and this... I'm talking about these.

speaker: REYES
line: Let go of me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What's going on here?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Okay, where'd he go?

speaker: REYES
line: Who? Where'd who go?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Where did Doggett take the body?

speaker: REYES
line: You're not making any sense, Brad. Agent Doggett didn't take any body anywhere.

speaker: REYES
line: What? You're looking at me like you don't believe me. Ask Agent Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm gonna go now. I've got a child at home.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: Body or no body, you were here, doing an autopsy. Doggett was here, without authorization.

speaker: REYES
line: Without authorization?

speaker: FOLLMER
line: He's out of control you know, Monica. Forget the X-Files, he'll take you down with him.

speaker: REYES
line: This was you, wasn't it? You floated that obituary to me... to set Agent Doggett up, using me.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: What obituary? I don't know what you are talking about. You came to me for help, remember? I'm only trying to help you help yourself.

speaker: REYES
line: I know exactly what you're doing, Brad. Don't forget to piss on all the corners before you leave.

speaker: FOLLMER
line: I didn't float any obituary!

speaker: FOLLMER
line: What is she talking about?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Son of a...

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Yeah?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Oh, hello.

speaker: REYES
line: Considering the recent violence against Agent Doggett, you might want to want to know who's at the door before you actually open it.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Next time I'll get a chair.

speaker: BYERS
line: Agent Doggett's gone.

speaker: REYES
line: What do you mean gone?

speaker: LANGLY
line: He and Assistant Director Skinner split for Maryland together.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Show her what we found. Before she makes any nasty remarks.

speaker: BYERS
line: It took some real hacking but uh, Carl Wormus, the man from Environmental Protection Agency who drowned in his car, he'd been receiving encrypted email data from a water reclamation plant in Maryland. From a worker there named Roland McFarland.

speaker: REYES
line: Encrypted data on what?

speaker: LANGLY
line: Don't know. Whatever it is may have gotten both these men killed.

speaker: SKINNER
line: There's no nameplates.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Yeah, I see that.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This is madness. Even if you're right and this guy can actually help your investigation we don't know if we're in the right area.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: This has got to be McFarland's area.

speaker: SKINNER
line: This might be his desk.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let's just grab the computer hard drive and get out of here.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: We're not sure if it's his.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Someone could walk in one of these doors any minute and it's not gonna matter.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: Just keep an eye out.

speaker: DOGGETT
line: What's chloramine?

speaker: SKINNER
line: What? Why are you asking me about chloramine?

speaker: DOGGETT
line: If this is McFarland's desk he's got tons of files on chloramine in it.

speaker: SKINNER
